DataElement.preferredName: Known Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score Assessment Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the known neurologic function scale domain clinical score type.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Known Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge._A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Neurologic Function Scale Domain Assessment Score Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.: A chair fitted with wheels for use as a means of transport by a person who is unable to walk as a result of illness, injury, or disability. The chair may be propelled by the occupant, pushed by another person, or electrically propelled.

Concepts.definition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

A chair fitted with wheels for use as a means of transport by a person who is unable to walk as a result of illness, injury, or disability. The chair may be propelled by the occupant, pushed by another person, or electrically propelled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A seizure that is not associated with fever.

Concepts.definition: A seizure that is not associated with fever.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Total Urinary Incontinence Or Fecal Incontinence

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Total Urinary Incontinence Or Fecal Incontinence
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.: Involuntary passage of urine outside the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Involuntary passage of stool from the rectum.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Involuntary passage of urine outside the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Involuntary passage of stool from the rectum.

PermissibleValues.value: Episodes of urinary or fecal incontinency
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Episode Urinary Incontinence Or Fecal Incontinence

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Episode Urinary Incontinence Or Fecal Incontinence
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A noteworthy happening that is distinctive in a series of related events.: Involuntary passage of urine outside the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Involuntary passage of stool from the rectum.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Of your own free will or design; not forced or compelled; controlled by individual volition.: A change in location or position.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Of your own free will or design; not forced or compelled; controlled by individual volition.
A change in location or position.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tube directed into the stomach, duodenum or jejunum from the nose, mouth or through the skin, for the purposes of delivering nutrition.

Concepts.definition: A tube directed into the stomach, duodenum or jejunum from the nose, mouth or through the skin, for the purposes of delivering nutrition.

PermissibleValues.value: Swallowing difficulty or other central nervous system dysfunction
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Dysphagia Or Other Central Nervous System Dysfunction

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Dysphagia Or Other Central Nervous System Dysfunction
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A symptom referring to difficulty in swallowing. It may be observed in patients with stroke, motor neuron disorders, cancer of the throat or mouth, head and neck injuries, Parkinson disease, and multiple sclerosis.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

Concepts.definition: A symptom referring to difficulty in swallowing. It may be observed in patients with stroke, motor neuron disorders, cancer of the throat or mouth, head and neck injuries, Parkinson disease, and multiple sclerosis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Visual impairment due to visual cortex dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: Visual impairment due to visual cortex dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gradual decline in amount or activity.: the exchange of information between objects, people, or groups.

Concepts.definition: A gradual decline in amount or activity.
The exchange of information between objects, people, or groups.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Impairment of the expression or comprehension of verbal and written language.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A neurological disorder characterized by the inability to execute skilled movements, despite having the willingness, physical ability and understanding of how to perform them.

Concepts.definition: Impairment of the expression or comprehension of verbal and written language.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A neurological disorder characterized by the inability to execute skilled movements, despite having the willingness, physical ability and understanding of how to perform them.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Of or relating to the process of hearing.: Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Of or relating to the process of hearing.
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.: The act of traveling on foot at a fast pace.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Autonomic nervous system overreaction to stimuli, most commonly after spinal cord injury at a T-5 level and above.

Concepts.definition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
The act of traveling on foot at a fast pace.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Autonomic nervous system overreaction to stimuli, most commonly after spinal cord injury at a T-5 level and above.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sight that is impaired.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Lack of sight in half of the normal field of vision.

Concepts.definition: Sight that is impaired.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Lack of sight in half of the normal field of vision.

PermissibleValues.value: Walking difficulties / spasticity / spastic gait (no assistance)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Difficulty Walking And/Or Spasticity And/Or Spastic Gait

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Difficulty Walking And/Or Spasticity And/Or Spastic Gait
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.: The act of traveling by foot.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Increased involuntary muscle tone caused by central nervous system disorders that affect the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances. Representative examples of disorders causing spasticity include brain or spinal cord injury, and multiple sclerosis.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis.

Concepts.definition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
The act of traveling by foot.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Increased involuntary muscle tone caused by central nervous system disorders that affect the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances. Representative examples of disorders causing spasticity include brain or spinal cord injury, and multiple sclerosis.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis.: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.: A tool that helps a person with a disability to do a certain task. Examples are a cane, wheelchair, scooter, walker, hearing aid, or special bed.

Concepts.definition: A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Devices that help an individual accomplish a task.
